The trajectory of a particle entering a uniform magnetic field from point O is as shown in the figure. The particle reaches point Q with a speed of magnitude $v$. The direction is at a 45° angle upward with respect to the x-axis. Then $v_{0} = v \cos 45^\circ$. Solution: $v = \sqrt{2} v_{0}$
The period of a particle moving in uniform circular motion in a magnetic field: $T =  rac{2 \pi R}{v} =  rac{\pi L}{v_{0}}$
Let the particle move from point O to point Q, with the central angle of motion being 90°. The time taken is: $t_{1} =  rac{1}{4} T =  rac{\pi L}{4 v_{0}}$
The time taken for the particle to travel from Q to P is $t_{2}$, $t_{2} =  rac{2L}{v_{0}}$
The time taken for the particle to move from point O to point P is: $t = t_{1} + t_{2} =  rac{\pi L}{4 v_{0}} +  rac{2L}{v_{0}} =  rac{(8 + \pi) L}{4 v_{0}}$
